H0.text: What was England's first publicly subscribed passenger railway. Liverpool and Manchester Railway

H1.text: What was England's first publicly subscribed passenger railway. Canterbury and Whitstable Railway

H2.text: What was England's first publicly subscribed passenger railway. Newcastle and Carlisle Railway

H3.text: What was England's first publicly subscribed passenger railway. Stockton-Darlington

A4.text: The Stockton and Darlington Railway (S&DR) was a railway company that operated in north-east England from 1825 to 1863. The world's first public railway to use steam locomotives, its first line connected collieries near Shildon with Darlington and Stockton in County Durham, and was officially opened on 27 September 1825.

A5.text: Passenger traffic started on 10 October 1825, after the required licence was purchased, using the Experiment coach hauled by a horse.
